entry.title: Game: Tales of Zestiria (Steam, 2015) (5)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Zestiria (Steam, 2015) (5)20160413
I played today for quite a while. I made it into the town across
the river and had a little bit of action there. Ultimately, it was
pretty boring. I feel like this game is just "wander to star,
watch anime scene, press the B button a lot." In contrast, Graces
f had a very complicated and detailed combat system. In this game,
even on the hardest difficulty, there's basically just two kinds
of battles: one where you press B and one where anything you do
seems to not work. It is very frustrating. I feel like it is a
waste of my time because I'm not in love with the characters. At
this point, the game has cost me $6.36 per hour and I don't really
enjoy it. Should I keep playing it even though I don't love it
just to "get my money's worth"? I feel like I'm going to drop it
and pay less attention to Tales for a while.

Total time: 7:51
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Zestiria
  • Steam
  • 2015

entry.content:

entry.title: Movie: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire, starring Jennifer Lawrence (2013) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire, starring Jennifer Lawrence (2013) (2)20160406
This was a weaker movie than I remember. I feel like the strongest
part is the gradual closeness of Peeta and Katniss. I feel like the
biggest weakness is that because Katniss doesn't know what is going
on, we're just too absorbed in the moment to understand the big
picture. 

This movie, however, made me much more curious about the
organization of Panem. For instance, where are the peace keepers
coming from? What's life like for them? How come they are not
weaklings like in the capitol? Why does President Snow want to make
their life good? How did he get power? Why does there seem to be no
consequence for them that District 12 has been razed? Don't they
really need them anyways?
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: The Hunger Games, starring Jennifer Lawrence (2012) (3)
entry.content:
Movie: The Hunger Games, starring Jennifer Lawrence (2012) (3)20160403
We watched this in preparation for watching the final movie. It was
pretty cool. There's a lot of subtlety in the movie and the
beginning is still extremely emotional. I kind of like that there's
almost no inkling of a bigger more epic story to build a trilogy
on.

entry.title: Movie: The Breakfast Club, directed by John Hughes (1985)
entry.content:
Movie: The Breakfast Club, directed by John Hughes (1985)20160402
This has so much more swearing than I remember. It is also not as
funny as I remember either. Of course, the movie is very funny, but
it doesn't strike me as primarily being a comedy. Instead, it is
much more dramatic and emotional. Like Sixteen Candles, it is
interesting to reflect on how influential the movie has been on
other movies.
  • Movies
  • 1985

entry.title: Movie: Sixteen Candles, starring Molly Ringwald (1984)
entry.content:
Movie: Sixteen Candles, starring Molly Ringwald (1984)20160401
This is such an iconic movie. There's so much in it that is
actually super weird and of very dubious morality. It's funny that
Long Duk Dong was from *REDACTED*. I like the Cusacks' roles.
  • Movies
  • 1984

entry.title: Book: To Be or Not To Be, by Ryan North (2013)
entry.content:
Book: To Be or Not To Be, by Ryan North (2013)20160330
I started this and mostly stayed on Shakespeare's path. It is fun
to read the book. I feel like I am too nervous about going down
non-canonical paths. I think that I will play it once normally,
then once as each character doing whatever seems funny. It would be
nice if there were any easy "back" button. I like how even the
introduction has choose-your-own-adventure paths.
  • Books
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice, starring Ben Affleck (2016)
entry.content:
Movie: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice, starring Ben Affleck (2016)20160330
I greatly enjoyed this movie. I thought that Batman was
awesome. Lex was a great villain. I enjoyed the ending. I
particularly liked Wonder Woman. Fun all around. It was a bit
disappointing that Lois was only a damsel in this movie. I enjoyed
the vision of the dark future, but I'm curious why it was shown
because it seems like The Flash instigated a bad thing. I wonder
why Martha Kent lost her job at Sears... maybe because it was
destroyed?
  • Movies
  • 2016
